page.description: The Print Options dialog is available when you elect to E-Mail or Save to File a layout in the Print Genie or Print Layout Genie dialogs. The Save as default link at the bottom of the page allows you to save the current settings as your default for the next time you email or save a layout.

case.title: Concatenate
case.description: Allows you to combine 2 PDF files into a single result file. See also Combine files.

case.title: Multilingual support
case.description: Adds support for international character sets.

case.title: Embed fonts
case.description: Include required fonts in the PDF instead of allowing them to be resolved externally.
case.note: If the font is protected, it can't be embedded; this is often the case for bar code fonts, such as Code39.

case.title: Linearize
case.description: If the PDF file will be displayed in a web application, linearization allows the browser to display pages from the PDF file before the entire PDF file has been downloaded. See also Linearize.

case.title: Black and white
case.description: Converts all colors to black, white, and gray.

case.title: Convert hyperlinks
case.description: Converts all hyperlinks started with "http://" into live links in the resulting PDF document.

case.title: JPEG Image Quality
case.description: Set the quality of JPEG images; this is a trade-off between image fidelity and size. Low quality uses the highest compression and produces the smallest images. No Compression produces the largest, highest-quality images.

case.title: Watermark
case.description: Enables the watermark option. See also Create from Bitmap and Merge files.

case.title: Watermark type
case.description: Specifies how to create the watermark. The options are:
"Text"
"PDF"

case.title: Text
case.description: The text to use as a watermark.

case.title: Font name
case.description: The font to use for the watermark text.

case.title: Font size
case.description: The font size to use for the watermark text.

case.title: Orientation
case.description: The rotation of the watermark text in 0.1 degree increments.

case.title: Font color
case.description: The font color to use for the watermark text.

case.title: Horizontal position
case.description: The horizontal position of the watermark text in 0.1 inch units. This positive value measured from the left edge of the page should take into account the minimum printer margin.

case.title: Vertical position
case.description: The vertical position of the watermark text in 0.1 inch units. This negative value measured from the top of the page should take into account the minimum printer margin.

case.title: Foreground
case.description: When enabled, places the watermark above the page text, partially obscuring page content. When disabled, places the watermark below the page text.

case.title: Watermark file name
case.description: The name of a PDF file to use as the watermark. Optionally, click Click to create PDF from Bitmap to display the Create PDF File from Bitmap dialog.

case.title: Encrypt PDF file
case.description: Enables the encryption option. See also Encrypt.

case.title: Owner password
case.description: Specifies the text to use as the owner password. Only the owner can change the User password and the document other settings.

case.title: User password
case.description: Specifies the text to use as the read password.

case.title: Can print
case.description: Specifies whether the reader can print the document.

case.title: Can modify document
case.description: Specifies whether the reader can edit the document.

case.title: Can copy
case.description: Specifies whether the reader can select text in the document and copy it.

case.title: Can add notes
case.description: Specifies whether the reader can add notes.

case.title: Use 128 bit key
case.description: Selects between 40 bit and 128 bit encryption. Readers will need Adobe Acrobat version 5 or higher to read 128 bit encrypted files.

case.title: Multilingual support
case.description: Adds support for international character sets.

case.title: Black and white
case.description: Converts all colors to black, white, and gray.

case.title: Convert hyperlinks
case.description: Converts all hyperlinks started with "http://" into live links in the resulting PDF document.

case.title: HTML File Type
case.description: Specifies how to represent multiple pages in the source document. The options are:
"Layers" - exports content as a single file with layers. Note : Mozilla and Firefox may have problems displaying this HTML.
"Single File" - exports content as pages in a single file.
"Multiple Files" - exports content as multiple files.

case.title: Multilingual support
case.description: Adds support for international character sets.

case.title: Black and white
case.description: Converts all colors to black, white, and gray.

case.title: RTF Type
case.description: Specifies how to represent multiple pages in the source document. The options are:
"Advanced RTF" - exports text and graphics, and uses frames to position objects.
"Full RTF" - exports text and graphics, but does not use frames to position objects. This format is easier to edit.
"Formatted Text" - exports RTF text only.
"Simple Text" - exports unformatted ASCII text.
